CVE.summary: drivers/firewire/ohci.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.32-git9, when packet-per-buffer mode is used, allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unknown other impact via an unspecified ioctl associated with receiving an ISO packet that contains zero in the payload-length field.

IAVM.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in Red Hat Linux Kernel

vFeed.Product: vFeed - The Correlated Vulnerability and Threat Database
vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

Oval.title: RHSA-2010:0046: kernel security and bug fix update (Important)
DSA-2005 linux-2.6.24 -- privilege escalation/denial of service/sensitive memory leak

drivers/firewire/ohci.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.32-git9, when packet-per-buffer mode is used, allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unknown other impact via an unspecified ioctl associated with receiving an ISO packet that contains zero in the payload-length field.
ELSA-2010:0046: kernel security and bug fix update (Important)
